2.51201686e+01, 2.51327412e+01]))ÔÉÅ
Parameters

  • coordinate_space_potential ‚Äì V(r, theta) where theta are the interaction parameters

  • n_theta ‚Äì number of interaction parameters

  • mu ‚Äì reduced mass (MeV); converted to 1/fm

  • is_complex ‚Äì Is the interaction complex (e.g. optical potentials)?

  • training_info ‚Äì either (1) parameters bounds or (2) explicit training points

if (1): This is a 2-column matrix. The first column are the lower bounds. The second are the upper bounds. Each row maps to a single parameter. if (2): This is MxN matrix. N is the number of parameters. M is the number of samples. explicit_training: Is training_info (1) or (2)? (1) is default :param n_train: How many snapshots to generate? Ignored if explicit_training is True. :param r: coordinate-space points at which the interaction is generated (used for training)

Methods

__init__(coordinate_space_potential,¬†...[,¬†...])

param coordinate_space_potential

V(r, theta) where theta are the interaction parameters

basis_functions(rho_mesh)

Computes the "bare" potential.

coefficients(alpha)

Basis function coefficients.

generate_basis(rho,¬†n_svd,¬†match_points,¬†...)

Generate a basis used to approximate the potential.

tilde(s,¬†alpha)

Computes tilde{U}(s, alpha, E) = V(s, alpha) / E E = E_{c.m.}, [E] = MeV = [v_r]

tilde_emu(s,¬†alpha)

tilde{U}(s, alpha, E) s = pr/hbar alpha are the parameters we are varying E = E_{c.m.}, [E] = MeV = [v_r]
